bonus_desc: Units receive +5 <combat/> Combat Strength on their home continent. +1 Appeal to all tiles in a city with a National Park. Gain the Rough Rider unique unit when they research the Rifling technology.
ability_desc: All Diplomatic policy slots in the current government are converted to Wildcard slots.

bonus_desc: The worship building for their Religion can be purchased by any player for just one-tenth of the usual <faith/> Faith cost. This worship building is enhanced to add 10% to the <science/> Science<comma/> <faith/> Faith<comma/> and <culture/> Culture output of Arabian cities.
ability_desc: Automatically receive the final <prophet/> Great Prophet when the next-to-last one is claimed (if you have not earned one already). +1 <science/> Science for each foreign city following Arabia's Religion.

bonus_desc: Luxury resources for his territory provide an <amenity/> Amenity to 2 extra cities. Military units receive +1 <combat/> Combat Strength when attacking for each different Luxury resource improved in Aztec lands.
ability_desc: Spend Builder charges to complete 20% of the original district cost.

bonus_desc: After recruiting or patronizing a <greatperson/> Great Person<comma/> 20% of its <greatperson/> Great Person point cost is refunded.
ability_desc: Rainforest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Campus<comma/> Commercial Hub<comma/> Holy Site<comma/> and Theater Square districts. Rainforest tiles provide +1 <housing/> Housing for Neighborhoods built adjacent to them.

bonus_desc: When building Ancient and Classical wonders you may spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original wonder cost. Builders receive an additional charge.
ability_desc: <eureka/> Eurekas and <inspiration/> Inspirations provide 50% of civics and technologies instead of 40%.

bonus_desc: Your <route/> Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 <gold/> Gold for Egypt. Other civilizations’ <route/> Trade Routes provide +2 <food/> Food for them and +2 <gold/> Gold for Egypt. Trading with Allies earns twice as many bonus Alliance Points.
ability_desc: +15% <production/> Production towards districts and wonders if placed next to a River. Floodplains do not block placement of districts and wonders.

bonus_desc: All cities founded on a continent other than your home continent receive a free melee unit. After founding<comma/> constructing a Royal Navy Dockyard there will grant an additional free melee unit. Gain the Redcoat unique unit when the Military Science technology is researched.
ability_desc: Each Archaeological Museum holds 6 <artifact/> Artifacts instead of 3<comma/> and can support 2 Archaeologists at once. Archaeological Museums are automatically themed when they have 6 artifacts.

bonus_desc: Has 1 level of <visibility/> Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she’s met. Receives a free Spy (and extra spy capacity) with the Castles technology. All spies start as Agents with a free promotion.
ability_desc: +20% <production/> Production toward Medieval<comma/> Renaissance<comma/> and Industrial era wonders. <tourism/> Tourism from wonders of any era is doubled.

bonus_desc: Additional Military policy slot. +7 <combat/> Combat Strength when attacking city-states.
ability_desc: Each city can build one more district than usual (exceeding the normal limit based on <population/> Population).

bonus_desc: Combat victories provide <culture/> Culture equal to 50% of the <combat/> Combat Strength of the defeated unit.
ability_desc: One extra wildcard policy slot in any government.

bonus_desc: +5% <culture/> Culture per city-state you are the Suzerain of.
ability_desc: One extra wildcard policy slot in any government.

bonus_desc: +5 <faith/> Faith for each civilization (including India) they have met that has founded a Religion and is not currently at war. Opposing civilizations receive double the war weariness for fighting against Gandhi.
ability_desc: Receives Follower Belief bonuses in a city from each Religion that has at least 1 follower.

bonus_desc: Can declare War of Territorial Expansion after gaining the Military Training Civic. +2 <movement/> Movement and +5 <combat/> Combat Strength for the first 10 turns after declaring a War of Territorial Expansion.
ability_desc: Receives Follower Belief bonuses in a city from each Religion that has at least 1 follower.

bonus_desc: Land units receive +5 <combat/> Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast; naval units receive +5 <combat/> Combat Strength in shallow water tiles. Builds Encampment<comma/> Holy Site and Theater Square districts in half the time.
ability_desc: All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.

bonus_desc: May not build Holy Site districts<comma/> gain Great Prophets<comma/> or found Religions. Gains all Beliefs of any Religion that has established itself in a majority of his cities.Receives an Apostle each time he finishes a M’banza or Theater Square district (of that city’s majority Religion).
ability_desc: +2 <food/> Food<comma/> +2 <production/> Production<comma/> +4 <gold/> Gold from each <relic/> Relic<comma/> <artifact/> Artifact<comma/> and <sculpture/> Sculpture Great Work of Art in addition to the usual <culture/> Culture. Receive 50% more <greatwriter/> Great Writer<comma/> <greatartist/> Great Artist<comma/> <greatmusician/> Great Musician<comma/> and <greatmerchant/> Great Merchant points. Palace has slots for 5 Great Work.

bonus_desc: Allows coastal raiding for all naval melee units and +50% <production/> Production toward all naval melee units.
ability_desc: Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology. Naval melee units heal in neutral territory. Units ignore additional <movements/> Movement costs from embarking and disembarking.

bonus_desc: All cities start with an additional City Center building. (Starts with a Monument building in the Ancient era).
ability_desc: All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post. If in <route/> Trade Route range of your <capital/> Capital<comma/> they also start with a road to it. Your <route/> Trade Routes earn +1 <gold/> Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities.

bonus_desc: Receives <science/> Science or <culture/> Culture from <route/> Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Russia (+1 per 3 technologies or civics ahead).
ability_desc: Extra Territory upon founding cities. +1 <faith/> Faith and +1 <production/> Production from Tundra.

bonus_desc: All units receive +5 <combat/> Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit<comma/> they heal up to 30 hit points.
ability_desc: Receive a second light cavalry unit or Saka Horse Archer each time you train a light cavalry unit or Saka Horse Archer.

bonus_desc: Inquisitors can Remove Heresy one extra time. Combat units have a bonus of +4 <combat/> Combat Strength against players following other Religions.
ability_desc: May form Fleets and Armadas earlier than usual (Mercantilism). <route/> Trade Routes between multiple continents receive bonus <gold/> Gold for routes to other civilizations<comma/> and bonus <food/> Food and <production/> Production for routes between your own cities with a Mission improvement adjacent to the City Center and not on your original <capital/> Capital’s continent.

bonus_desc: May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe<comma/> they and their allies share pillage rewards and share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles. Their Alliances gain Alliance Points for being at war with a common foe.
ability_desc: When you capture a Barbarian outpost<comma/> receive a Tribal Village reward in addition to the usual <gold/> Gold. Pay half the usual cost to levy city-state units.

bonus_desc: The Religion founded by Poland becomes the majority in an adjacent city that loses a tile to a Polish Culture Bomb. Holy sites gain standard Faith adjacency bonus from adjacent districts. All <relic/>Relics provide bonus Faith (+2)<comma/> Culture (+2) and Gold (+4).
ability_desc: Building an Encampment or Fort triggers a Culture Bomb<comma/> claiming surrounding tiles. One Military policy slot in all governments is converted into a Wildcard policy slot.

bonus_desc: +100% <production/> Production if either they have received a declaration of war in the past 10 turns or if they have liberated a city in the past 20 turns.
ability_desc: +3 <housing/> Housing in coastal cities. Pastures trigger a Culture Bomb. Yields from Campuses<comma/> Commercial Hubs<comma/> Holy Sites and Theater Squares are +1 in tiles with Charming Appeal<comma/> +3 in Breathtaking.

bonus_desc: +2 <movement/> Movement for the first 10 turns after declaring a Surprise War on a major civilization. +5 Loyalty per turn in occupied cities with a garrisoned unit. Declaring a Surprise War only counts as a Formal War for the purpose of warmongering and war weariness.
ability_desc: +1 <route/> Trade Route capacity with the Political Philosophy civic. Receive +2 <gold/> Gold and +1 <culture/> Culture for routes between your own cities. Roads built in your territory are one level more advanced than usual.

bonus_desc: Cities do not incur war weariness. All military units heal completely when this player captures a city with a world wonder.
ability_desc: Receive boosts upon city conquest: a <eureka/> Eureka for each Encampment or Campus in the conquered city and an <inspiration/> Inspiration for each Holy Site or Theater Square.

bonus_desc: +20% <production/> Production towards all districts rising to +40% if there is a Nubian Pyramid adjacent to the City Center.
ability_desc: +50% <production/> Production toward Ranged units. All Ranged units gain +50% combat experience. Mines over strategic resources provide +1 <production/> Production. Mines over bonus and luxury resources provide +2 <gold/> Gold.

bonus_desc: Holy Sites provide +2 <food/> Food and +1 <housing/> Housing if placed on a river. Holy Sites trigger a Culture Bomb.
ability_desc: +3 <faith/> Faith and +1 <amenity/> Amenity from entertainment to each city with an aqueduct. Farms provide +2 <food/> Food if adjacent to an Aqueduct.

bonus_name: Exalted Goddess of the Three Worlds
bonus_desc: Naval units can be purchased with <faith/> Faith. Religious units pay no movement to embark or disembark. +2 <faith/> Faith to City Centers that are adjacent to Coast or Lake tiles.
ability_desc: Coast and Lake tiles provide a minor adjacency bonus for Holy Site<comma/> Campus<comma/> Industrial Zone<comma/> and Theater Square districts. +1 <amenity/> Amenity from entertainment to each Entertainment Complex adjacent to a Coast or Lake tile.

bonus_desc: All Alliance types provide Shared Visibility. Your <route/> Trade Routes grant +1 <food/> Food per Camp or Pasture in the receiving city. Your <route/> Trade Routes grant +1 <gold/> Gold for Poundmaker per Camp or Pasture in the receiving city.
ability_desc: +1 <route/> Trade Route capacity and a free Trader with the Pottery technology. Unclaimed tiles within 3 tiles of a Cree city come under Cree control when a Trader first moves into them.

bonus_desc: Your <route/> Trade Routes to your own cities provide +1 Loyalty per turn for the starting city. <route/> Trade Routes to foreign cities or from foreign cities provide +1 <culture/> Culture to you.
ability_desc: Major adjacency bonus for Campuses<comma/> Theater Squares<comma/> and Industrial Zones if next to a river. Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing a Harbor.

bonus_name: Glory of the World<comma/> Kingdom and Faith
bonus_desc: +100% <faith/> Faith for 10 turns after declaring a Protectorate War. Each <envoy/> Envoy you send to a city-state of your majority Religion counts as two <envoy/> Envoys. (Must have a majority Religion).
ability_desc: When making Dedications at the beginning of a Golden Age or Heroic Age<comma/> receive the Normal Age bonus towards improving Era Score in addition to the other bonus.

bonus_desc: Governors established in a city provide +3% <culture/> Culture and <science/> Science for each Promotion they have earned<comma/> including their first.
ability_desc: Mines receive +1 <science/> Science if there is an adjacent Seowon district. Farms receive +1 <food/> Food if there is an adjacent Seowon district.

bonus_desc: If a Mapuche Unit defeats an enemy unit within the borders of the enemy city<comma/> that city loses 20 Loyalty. Pillaging a plot in an enemy city causes it to lose 5 loyalty.
ability_desc: All units trained in cities with an established Governor gain 25% more experience in combat. +10 <combat/> Combat Strength bonus against civilizations that are in a Golden Age.

bonus_desc: All cavalry class units gain +3 <combat/> Combat Strength and a chance to capture defeated enemy cavalry class units.
ability_desc: Starting a <route/> Trade Route Immediately creates a <post/> Trading Post in the destination city. Receive an extra level of <visibility/> Diplomatic Visibility for possessing a <post/> Trading Post in any city of a civilization. All Mongolian units double the usual <combat/> Combat Bonus for having a higher level of <visibility/> Diplomatic Visibility than their opponent.

bonus_desc: Can declare a War of Liberation after gaining the Defensive Tactic Civic. +100% <production/> Production and +2 <movement/> Movement for the first 10 turns after declaring War of Liberation.
ability_desc: Happy cities receive an additional +5% <science/> Science and +5% <production/> Production. Happy cities generate +1 <greatscientist/> Great Scientist point per Campus and +1 <greatengineer/> Great Engineer point per Industrial Zone. Ecstatic cities double all these amounts.

bonus_desc: May form Corps (Mercenaries Civic) and Armies (Nationalism Civic) earlier. An additional +5 <combat/> Base Combat Strength to both Corps and Armies.
ability_desc: Cities with a garrisoned unit get +3 Loyalty per turn<comma/> or +5 if it is a Corps or Army. Conquering a city with a unit will upgrade it into a Corps or Army<comma/> if the proper Civics are unlocked.
